intro: Mallotus micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered mallot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces woody capsules as fruit. Mallotus micranthus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
